title: Performance
description: Performance of a system measures the amount of useful work it can do at any time, or over a measurable period.
key-ideas: A factor, device, or application that is limiting system performance is called a bottleneck.
Network performance is measured in bandwidth.
Use routers, VLANs, and subnets to break up broadcast domains.
Use switches to break up collision domains.
Spanning Tree Protocol to fix layer 2 loops.
Quality of Service (QoS) to prioritize traffic.
Choose wireless channels that don't interfere.
Use site survey to choose optimal AP placement.
Content Delivery Networks load static content from a geographically close location.
Increase cache size for frequently accessed requests.
Increase buffer size for servers with many connections.
Reduce the number of inline devices.
